The academic papers that make up this thesis address current topics on supplementary pension that are characteristic of pension funds and open pension entities. In the first paper , the impacts resulting from changes in the minimum retirement ages of the Brazilian Pension Reform were analyzed. Actuarial methods were applied to primary data combined with the rules of a variable - benefit plan that offers a minimum pension benefit . The amounts required for mathematical reserves , to cover this minimum benefit , were calculated. The comparison of results, resulting from combinations of different minimum ages, discount rates and other assumptions, showed increases in reserves and post -employment benefits. Consequently, deficits were reduced and positive financial e ffects were produced for participants and plan sponsors. In the second stage of the study, the sensitivity analyzes were perfected in an innovative way, useful in anticipating actions to identify, address and mitigate possible impacts. In the following paper, the research carried out found the tax waiver resulting from the extension of tax benefits, exclusive to companies taxed by actual income , to companies taxed by presumed profit method . These benefits are triggered, reducing IRPJ and CSLL, when companie s contribute to their employees' supplementary pension plans. From data collected and payrolls, an actuarial simulator was used to discover optimal rates of contribution, on an equal basis between participants and sponsors, enough to guarantee future value of benefits that cover 65% of the workerâ€™s last salary. In possession of the total amounts of the employer's contribution, a maximum tax waiver of 3.7% was identified in relation to the annu al collection. T his represents a low level for the federal govern ment , but relevant and no additional charge, or with minimal costs , for companies, adding to HR policies a direct post-employment benefit to employees. This extension fills a gap in legislation and contributes to a more balanced tax system, enhancing the i ncrease in productivity and the retention of qualified labor, factors that improve competition. The workers will now have an additional pension benefit , which will lead to the progress of social welfare in the post -employment phase The final paper presents the proposition of a new method to adjust incompatible actuarial rates in pension funds: the Consistent Actuarial Rate (MAC). The research identified elements that influenced the definition of actuarial rates contained in the temporal sample of 22 BD plan s. It was proved that these rates , defined in meetings of the pension f unds' Deliberative Council, do not correspond statistically to the rules of the current regulations. These instructions determine actuarial rates corresponding to the expected profitability , at longer horizons, of the pension plan's investments , as a general rule, or that it will belong to an interval generated by an average of ETTJ. The use of MAC in the sample, adjusting actuarial rates for 2018, produced more consistent estim ates of the mathematical provisions. The adoption of MAC by PREVIC will make it possible to improve the standards, resulting in contribution levels that are more appropriate to the plans and making its solvency levels more reliable, benefiting all involved .
